episode_title: How to Build a $700k Business with 50% Margins with Bryant Suellentrop
transcript:
ï»¿Nikolas Hulewsky (00:00.91)
All right, Bryant, tell me about your business. What do you do and how do you make money?


Bryant Suellentrop (00:05.548)
Sure, happy to Nick. Thanks for having me. My name is Brian Solentrop. I live in Charlotte, North Carolina and I run a offshore recruiting company called Elevate and Delegate. So we help mostly small businesses hire offshore and do it the right way and do it on a one-time fee basis so that that person becomes a part of their team and they can get back to work. That's basically what I do.


Nikolas Hulewsky (00:30.599)
Give me an idea how big is Elevate and Delegate?


Bryant Suellentrop (00:33.816)
So over the last four years, we've done about 1,200 placements. So we're not the giant behemoths in the industry. For people in this industry, they know that there's multibillion dollar companies. mean, there's companies that do the outsourcing for firms like Facebook and Airbnb or support those kinds of guys. And they're massive companies. I like to think of myself as just a more consultative play where


We work with small business owners and just keep it, keep it lean. We have a team now, we've shrunk our team actually because of how much automation and AI we've been able to use on the recruiting side, which has been really exciting. So now it's just me and four others. We've had as many as 13, 14 people on the team, but it's just not necessary for us anymore.


Nikolas Hulewsky (01:25.208)
Okay, give me an idea though. Give me something juicy. Top line revenue last year. What was it?


Bryant Suellentrop (01:30.104)
Yeah, sure. Top line revenue last year was... I know that you're not going to believe me when I say like, I don't remember off the top of my head, but I think we were probably somewhere around like 700K last year, 650, something like that. And we did that the year previous kind of similarly.


Nikolas Hulewsky (01:38.156)
I don't believe you.

And then margin performance. What do these types of business do?

Yeah, we've kind of gone through some, I mean, I would say these types of businesses generally operate at something like a 50 % margin. But that has, there's so many variables, right? We operate on a one-time fee basis. So we get paid once, right? For the companies that do the management fee where, you know, they're just taking a percentage of that person's salary, like in perpetuity, they have a lot more revenue on the longterm.

volume.
